Platform.Title: University of Vermont Affymetrix Streptococcus mutans UA159 3K microarray version 1

Sample.Title: Low Mn, experiment A

Channel.Source: Streptococcus mutans UA159 Low Mn, experiment A
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Chelex-treated semi-defined medium was supplemented with ferric citrate, magnesium chloride, and 0.1 micromolar (Low) MnCl2
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Grown in reconstituted chelex-treated semi-defined medium
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells resuspended in TRI Reagent (Ambion) were disrupted in BIO101 FastPrep machine. Ethanol-precipitated nucleic acid was DNAse treated on an RNAeasy column according to the recommendation of the supplier (Qiagen).
Channel.Label: Biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: RNA samples were amplified using a Two-Cycle cDNA Synthesis Kit according to the manufacturerÕs instructions (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA). Following second cycle, second strand cDNA synthesis, and cleanup, biotinylated-cRNA was prepared by in vitro transcription, fragmented and labeled using a streptavadin-phycoerythrin conjugate.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Samples were applied to Affymetrix Gene Chip at 45C for 16 hr.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Biotinylated anti-streptavadin antibodies were used to amplify the signal. Probe arrays were scanned using a Hewlett-Packard Gene Array Scanner (Agilent Technologies).

Series.Title: Global transcriptional analysis of S. mutans metalloregulation
Series.Summary: Multiple S. mutans genes that are subject to SloR control are likely contributors to virulence. The regulation of these genes in response to metal ion limitation vs. availability in the oral cavity can significantly facilitate the caries-forming process and hence continued analysis of these data can reveal novel candidate genes for the purposes of therapeutic intervention and/or prevention. Keywords: Genetic modification, dose response, metalloregulation
Series.Overall-Design: Analyses were based on a comparison between low Mn and high Mn groups (paired comparisons A, B, and C) and the monitoring of gene expression in the presence (WT) or absence (mutant) of SloR under moderate Mn content. Analysis of significance amongst all genes and the formulation of hypotheses that are relevant to the cariogenic state were performed.
